name: Zazos
headline: No-code HR platform for startups.
description:
Zazos is the no-code HR platform. We allow startups to set up unique workspaces that centralize information and tasks for employees. For example, companies can create a home page where people can view stock options, ask for time off, and see everyone's profiles. On Zazos, anyone can build and share people management apps, without knowing how to code.

As companies grow, the lack of customization of current software forces Heads of HR to buy multiple disconnected tools, allocate engineers to build and maintain people-related projects or use spreadsheets.

founders.name: Murilo Narciso, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder and CEO of Zazos (YC S21). Murilo is a software engineer and was the Head of HR at Quero Education (YC S16), joining when it had 150 employees and scaling it to 700+. He also built Rio, an HR app that 70% of Quero’s employees used on a weekly basis.

generated_description:
Zazos is a promising startup that launched in 2021 as part of Y Combinator's Batch S21. Based in São Paulo, Brazil, Zazos positions itself as a no-code HR platform specifically designed for startups, striving to streamline and simplify human resources management.

At its core, Zazos empowers companies to create tailored workspaces that centralize essential information and tasks for their employees. This means startups can build a customized homepage where employees can easily access stock options, request time off, and view team profiles—all without needing to write a single line of code. It addresses a significant pain point for growing companies: the convoluted and often fragmented nature of existing HR software. Instead of juggling multiple disconnected tools or relying on engineers (or spreadsheets) for people management, Zazos offers a cohesive solution where users can build and share people management applications seamlessly.

Zazos operates as a SaaS (Software as a Service) company and has a compact team of 15 dedicated employees. With no external linkages diluting their focus, they pride themselves on customization—offering to create tailor-made apps that suit individual company needs. They are also proactive in maintaining and updating their platform, with new applications rolling out weekly.

For those considering whether to let Zazos handle their HR needs, several companies already trust the platform, including companies like Insider, Zippi, and G4. 

If you want to learn more about how Zazos can simplify your HR processes and accelerate your startup's success, you can visit their website at [zazos.com](https://www.zazos.com). Here, you can explore pricing plans, book demos, and even get in touch for personalized app solutions. Their mission is clear: make HR management less of a headache and more about empowering teams.
